text: when you think of a data warehouse what

when I used to hear customers say they

it's this unicorn that no one actually

all your data it's gonna service all the

the other every time we saw this project
the the same sort of things started to

thing existed until I took a closer look

now it's snowflake our mission is to
enable every organization to be data

insights and analytics track hopefully
this will ring true and sound quite
appropriate to everyone in the room but
this mission is a big one and we're only
a small piece of it of course right
every business wants to make better
faster decisions based on their data but
for one reason or the other and they're
they're limited by existing technologies
so our founders saw these problems and
they saw them fit into a couple of
different buckets they were both at
Oracle and so they were sort of in the
trenches there they saw the the
limitations of legacy architectures they
saw the complexity involved when data

they also saw the complexity involved

they sort of decided to take a different

make sure that you've prioritized
requests and so on elasticity was a

at least a limitation with how big you

finally diversity so the types of data

most part for a lot of the relational
sources and so what we built at
snowflake at a very high level is three
things the first is that it's a sequel
based data warehouse so we're fully ANSI
sequel which means it's really familiar
to use again our founders bet on sequel
they just said we needed to build a
better sequel data warehouse the second
is that we were built specifically for
the cloud so that just means we're using
the cloud infrastructure we are we are
using the AWS fabric to deliver
something that's scalable and flexible
the way that the cloud was meant to be
and then third is were your full service
so we are a data warehouse as a service
we provide the platform to you so that
not only is there no I'm fruss truck
sure to manage but there's also no
tuning no manual indexing partitioning
backups that's all taken care of
and how we do that is with a completely
new architecture so traditionally

and both of them had their limitations
so shared disk you tended to see a lot
of contention you're really limited by

forward as data sizes grow and so on

the distributed way of approaching

heard though is scaling these

still takes time and it's not an instant
like the way you expect it to be and so
the brand-new architecture that our
founders built we called the multi
cluster shared data architecture
essentially we've separated the storage
and compute layers from the ground up so
when you load data into snowflake you
are paying for just the cost of s3 at
that point we pass on that cost to you
we don't mark it up now when you need to
do something with that data or add more
data into the system that's when you
spin up compute clusters so you could
spin up a two node cluster here to load
some data in a one node cluster to do
some transformation
and then perhaps another third cluster
here to query the data from a bi tool
all of these clusters do not interfere
with each other there are essentially
dedicated resources for each workload
and that gives you again huge
flexibility and not no contention now
being a cloud-based data warehouse and a
full-service of course security is very

logical model and because it is cloud

now surrounding that storage layer is

t-shirt sizes so
extra small as a single node the

so the important thing here is well to

ETL on its own cluster and the sales

there's not contention like you would

the other thing we can do here is really

maybe we're gonna create a clone for

so this is sort of a little bit more
about how that zero copy data cloning
works again
metadata only no actual data is copied
the other thing that we provide is
something called continuous and data
protection so all the files sitting on
s3 are immutable so any updates you make
on your data will not modify existing
files right will create new ones and
then when you commit the change will
point everyone to the new copies and
that means the old files they're still
there we actually keep them around on
purpose for by default it's 24 hours but
you can set that all the way to 90 days
if you want and what that means is if I
drop a table by mistake which sometimes
might happen or if I update a table and
it corrupt it corrupts I can essentially
go back in time and restore that entire

comprehensive data protection is again
built into the product where again make

to use into to make sure that you're not

and it's not just a one-time operation

partitions what that enables is for us
when you run a query we can run that

really good pruning you might have a

the whole thing comeback right we don't

returned and so on the on the

we're seeing a consolidation of all of
